terms.Curl: Hashing function, designed for the Internet of things, that uses the SHA-3 sponge-based construction.
terms.Kerl: Ternary version of the Keccek-384 hashing function that takes a 48 byte input and produces a 243 trit output, using [two's complement](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two%27s_complement).
terms.Winternitz one-time signature: Quantum-resistant signature scheme that's used to sign transactions that withdraw IOTA tokens.

terms.blowball: Tangle formation where a majority of tip transactions reference one central transaction.
terms.subgraph: Section of the ledger that contains all transactions between a milestone transaction and tip transactions

child.definition: Transaction that directly references two other transactions.

confirmed.definition: State of a transaction when it's been approved by a milestone

depth.definition: Entry milestone that's used to start tip selection through a subgraph.

terms.future set: Group of transactions that approve the same transaction.
terms.inconsistent: State of a transaction when it leads to a negative balance of IOTA tokens
terms.inclusion: State of a transaction that's been referenced by given tip transactions or a milestone transaction
terms.invalid: State of a transaction when it's either non-solid, inconsistent, or it references a transaction that's too old
terms.milestone: Valid transaction that's created by the Coordinator. IRI nodes use milestones to determine if transactions are confirmed.
terms.minimum weight magnitude: Integer that sets the amount of work that will be carried out on a transaction hash during PoW. The solution to the computational puzzle is a transaction hash that contains the same number of trailing nines as the MWM.
terms.parent: Transaction that is directly referenced by a child transaction
terms.pending: State of a transaction when it's been seen by the network, but not yet confirmed
terms.reattach: Recreate and resend a transaction by requesting new tip transactions, recalculating the transaction and bundle hashes, signing any value transactions, and doing proof of work
terms.rebroadcast: Send the same transaction to a node again
terms.solid: State of a transaction when an IRI node has its entire history (all directly and indirectly referenced transactions) in its ledger
terms.tail transaction: Transaction 0 in a bundle. IRI nodes contruct and validate bundles by traversing the trunk transaction of each tail transaction.
terms.tip selection: Process whereby a node selects two tip transactions from the Tangle

terms.trit: Digit in a ternary number system. Trits are often represented by 1, 0, -1.
terms.tryte: A tryte is 3 trits which can represent 27 values
